Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student Travel Grant Support for IEEE International Conference on Communications 2021. To Be Held in Montreal Canada, June 14-18,2021.

Division.LongName: Div Of Electrical, Commun & Cyber Sys

Award.AbstractNarration: The 2020 Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) International Conference on Communications (ICC) is an IEEE Communications Society flagship conference widely attended by researchers and practitioners in the field. Attending conferences such as ICC is beneficial for the professional development of graduate and undergraduate students in the area of communications research.<br/><br/>This award provides support for students in the United States to attend this conference. Since the conference will be virtual, support to help pay for registration fees will be provided. It will help the students be exposed to recent development in the field, and network with professionals. This will in turn help build the next generation workforce in communications.<br/><br/>This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The objective of this project is to provide funding from NSF to support graduate students conducting research in communication related areas to participate in and present papers at the 2021 IEEE International Conference on Communications (ICC 2021).  IEEE ICC is the flagship conference of the IEEE Communication Society. Since its inception in 1965, ICC has become the primary venue for presenting new research results in a broad spectrum of communication related research areas, such as communication networks, signal processing, wireless, optical, hybrid, and multimedia communications, etc. IEEE ICC is widely attended by researchers from both academia and industry all around the world. 

Sixteen US-based students were awarded a travel grant to attend the ICC 2021. The travel grant covers the registration cost for each student. The awardees particiated ICC 2021 virtually and presented their research papers at the conference. ICC provides a venue for a student to share their research results with the global research community, to interact with experienced senior researchers as well as other students from all over the world, to keep track of leading edge communication technologies, to learn and understand different cultures, and to expand their horizon in terms of both research and life experience. The Student Travel Grant provide students the opportunity to learn the state-of-the-art in the field, which will stimulate new ideas and further advance communication technologies. The Student Travel Grant can help attract more students to take a career path as a communication engineer/researcher,and will help prepare fresh blood for the communication research community.
